sub_title: Professional in Political Studies and Conflict Resolution, with an academic background in sociology.
summary:
Professional in Political Studies and Conflict Resolution, with an academic background in sociology. Over 12 years work experience with specific focus on: (a) Research; (b) preparation and development of programme baselines; (c) evaluation and systematization of experiences; (d) coordination and implementation of international development programmes; and (e) Participatory Planning. Strong theoretical and practical knowledge in a wide number of key issues such as political analysis, database analysis (SPSS), human rights of vulnerable groups (ethnic minorities, children and adolescents); prevention and reduction of violent behaviour among young people and violence against women; prevention of the consumption of psychoactive substances; productive development; and sociocultural diagnoses in indigenous communities.
Capacity for leadership and creativity, respect for cultural diversity, teamwork, excellent interpersonal skills, ability to lead negotiation processes and conflict management, responsibility and motivation aimed at achieving organizational, team and personal goals.
